titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the History of Industrial Engineers, Inc. Typescript
History of Industrial Engineers, Inc. Typescript

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: History of Industrial Engineers, Inc. typescript
did.abstract: Typescript history (written between 1953 and 1974) of the engineering company founded in 1933 by four Stanford alumni: F. L. Kallam, Gregory H. Lifur, William L. Rifenberick, and Angelo F. Semino. The company developed and produced machinery for the petroleum refining industry; it was dissolved in 1972.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

acqinfo.p: Administrative transfer, School of Earth Sciences, 2002.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: History of Industrial Engineers, Inc. Typescript (SCM0217). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Rifenberick earned his A.B. in mechanical engineering at Stanford University in 1917 and his engineer's degree in 1919.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Typescript history (written between 1953 and 1974) of the engineering company founded in 1933 by four Stanford alumni: F. L. Kallam, Gregory H. Lifur, William L. Rifenberick, and Angelo F. Semino. The company developed and produced machinery for the petroleum refining industry; it was dissolved in 1972.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.subject: Petroleum refineries --Equipment and supplies--Design and construction.
